form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Banks (for himself and Mr. Ricketts) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions of higher education to disclose campus policies relating to responding to certain incidents of civil disturbance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Tax Dollars for College Encampments Act of 2025.

subsection.header: Disclosure of campus security policy and campus crime statistics
subsection.text: Section 485(f)(1)(J) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092(f)(1)(J)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking A statement and inserting (i) A statement;
by inserting after subclause (I), as so redesignated, the following:

subclause.text: respond to incidents of civil disturbance occurring on the campus, including with respect to coordination of such response with State, local, and campus law enforcement;

paragraph.text: by redesignating clauses (ii) and (iii) as subclauses (III) and (IV), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term incident of civil disturbance means a civil unrest activity (including a demonstration, riot, or strike) that disrupts the community in which it is taking place and requires intervention to—

subclause.text: prevent the disruption of learning, as applicable.

subsection.header: Accrediting agency or association operating procedures
subsection.text: Section 496(c) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1099b(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (8), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (9), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
monitors an institution’s compliance with section 485(f)(1)(J).
